It should consist of the following lines and loops: - Line 1: from [0.0, 0.0546] to [0.0482, 0.0] - Line 2: from [0.0482, 0.0] to [0.3267, 0.2455] - Line 3: from [0.3267, 0.2455] to [0.2693, 0.292] - Line 4: from [0.2693, 0.292] to [0.0, 0.0546] These lines form a closed loop creating the face of part 1. Next, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3267. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.0528 towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **Part 2: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.** Create a new coordinate system for part 2, with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2693, 0.0563, 0.2501] Draw a 2D sketch for face 1 of part 2, following the coordinate system defined above. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.4807. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.0563 towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction. *Note:* These instructions are provided in the context of the final shape, a rectangular prism with a slight taper, assuming no further modifications.</description>
